intro: Parnassia amoena, commonly known as the white mooncup, is a flowering plant native to the northern regions of North America. It belongs to the family Ranunculaceae and is characterized by its striking, white, cup-shaped flowers that resemble miniature cups. The plant typically grows in moist, acidic soils in open woodlands and meadows. Its leaves are palmately divided, with five to seven lobes, and it produces small, greenish-yellow fruits that contain seeds. Parnassia amoena is often found in association with other alpine and subalpine flora, thriving in cool, temperate climates.
